channel.title: What file do i need to edit class files?
channel.description: soz i know i asked a question a min ago but what file do i need to edit class files?

item.title: What file do i need to edit class files?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Class files arent programs… there files. when you compile a java file you get a class file, any other time you edit java and compile again the class file will update itself, class files are written in bytecode, this is so the Java Virtual Machine can read it.

P.S. i think its java virtual machine, im not to sure.

Read full topic
item.source: What file do i need to edit class files?

item.title: What file do i need to edit class files?
item.dc:creator: @daraman2000 daraman2000
item.description:
@daraman2000 wrote:

a class file is written in bytecode, you edit the .java file with notepad and use the program called compiler and the class file changes itself. the class file is only a program made of the .java file with the same name.

also

please don’t double post, you could’ve edited ur last post on .cfg files.
